messages.title: Re-elect Alan Whitehead
messages.content: I've been your Member of Parliament for 22 years now and before that served our city as Leader of the Council. I've always taken tough decisions to make it work but I've always aimed to get the best deals for Southampton and put first.

messages.title: A Labour government will:
messages.content:
Tackle the climate emergency whilst providing hundreds of thousands of new jobs through the Green New Deal
Reverse Tory cuts to policing
Invest in our NHS and protect it from a trade deal with the USA
Invest in schools and 6th form colleges to give our children the best start in life.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Tackle the climate emergency whilst providing hundreds of thousands of new jobs through the Green New Deal.
Invest in our NHS and protect it from a trade deal with the USA.
Invest in schools and 6th form colleges to give our children the best start in life.

issues.education: Worked with local schools and 6th form colleges to fight Tory cuts to education.
issues.environment: Served as Shadow Energy and Climate Change Minister working on Labour's solutions to the climate emergency.
issues.health: Helped thousands of local people who have been devastated by Tory cuts to key public services.
issues.socialWelfare: About Brexit they talk about Brexit and Brexit plans to the exclusion of every issue they've been about Tory cut plans to benefits slashed to parents worried about their children's future and the loss of police on the streets.

leaflet.personalStatement: As Labour's candidate for Southampton Test I will be talking about all of the issues that people say matter to them day in and day out.

politicalExperience.achievements: Taken tough decisions to make it work but I've always aimed to get the best deals for Southampton and put first.

politicalExperience.role: Shadow Energy and Climate Change Minister
politicalExperience.achievements: Working on Labour's solutions to the climate emergency.

contactInformation.address: Unit 39, Basepoint, Andersons Road, Southampton SO14 5FE

images.caption: Alan Whitehead speaking to an audience with a microphone.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Make sure of your vote in order to vote you will need to be individually registered. Register by 26th November to vote in the General Election on 12th December. You will need to register again if you've already registered. Visit www.gov.uk/register-to-vote 'You will need your National Insurance number and an address in the UK.' For further information or to request a copy or contact Electoral Services at the City Council: email elections@southampton.gov.uk or call 023 8083 2245.
